Interface FormattedFunction<T,R>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the input of the function
R - the type of the output of the function
All Superinterfaces:
Function<T,R>
All Known Subinterfaces:
FormattedNamedFunction<T,R>
public interface FormattedFunction<T,R> extends Function<T,R>
A function which can format its output according to a format. This function works like Function, but provides a format in the form of a String that follows the format string syntax used by PrintStream.printf(String, Object...).

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final String
    UNFORMATTED_FORMAT
    The default format to use when a format is not provided.

    • UNFORMATTED_FORMAT

      static final String UNFORMATTED_FORMAT
      The default format to use when a format is not provided.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • format

      String format()
      Returns the format of this formatted function as a string formatted according to the format string syntax used by PrintStream.printf(String, Object...).
      Returns:
      the format of this formatted function

    • format

      static String format(Function<?,?> f)
      Returns the format of a function. If the function is a FormattedFunction, returns the result of format(); otherwise, return UNFORMATTED_FORMAT.
      Parameters:
      f - the function
      Returns:
      the format of the function

    • from

      static <T,R> FormattedFunction<T,R> from(Function<T,R> f, String format)
      Builds a formatted function given a function and a format.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the input of the function
      R - the type of the output of the function
      Parameters:
      f - the function
      format - the format
      Returns:
      the formatted function

    • from

      static <T,R> FormattedFunction<T,R> from(Function<T,R> f)
      Builds a formatted function given a function, possibly with the default format. If the input function f is a FormattedFunction, simply returns f; otherwise, calls from(Function, String) with the default format UNFORMATTED_FORMAT as format.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the input of the function
      R - the type of the output of the function
      Parameters:
      f - the function
      Returns:
      the named function

    • applyFormatted

      default String applyFormatted(T t)
      Applies this function to the given argument and format the result using the format. Formatting is performed through String.formatted(Object...).
      Parameters:
      t - the function argument
      Returns:
      the function result formatted using the format

    • compose

      default <V> FormattedFunction<V,R> compose(Function<? super V, ? extends T> before)
      Returns a composed formatted function that first applies the before function to its input, and then applies this formatted function to the result. The format of the returned formatted function is the same of this function.
      Specified by:
      compose in interface Function<T,R>
      Type Parameters:
      V - the type of input of the before function, and of the composed function
      Parameters:
      before - the function to apply before this function is applied
      Returns:
      the composed formatted function

    • andThen

      default <V> FormattedFunction<T,V> andThen(Function<? super R, ? extends V> after)
      Returns a composed formatted function that first applies this formatted function to its input, and then applies the after function to the result. If the after function is a formatted function, the format of the returned function is the one of after; otherwise, it is the default format UNFORMATTED_FORMAT.
      Specified by:
      andThen in interface Function<T,R>
      Type Parameters:
      V - the type of output of the after function, and of the composed function
      Parameters:
      after - the function to apply after this function is applied
      Returns:
      the composed formatted function

    • reformatted

      default FormattedFunction<T,R> reformatted(String format)
      Returns a formatted function operating as this function but with the format set to the provided format.
      Parameters:
      format - the new format
      Returns:
      the reformatted named function

    • reformattedToFit

      default FormattedFunction<T,R> reformattedToFit(Collection<? extends T> ts)
      Returns a formatted function operating as this function but with the format set to the shortest fixed length string-based format %s which completely show the string representation of each one of the provided input arguments. If this function format is not %s, returns this formatted function. Otherwise, applies with format the function to each t in ts, takes note of the resulting string length, and sets the format of the returned function to %$n$s, where $n$ is the largest length.
      Parameters:
      ts - the input arguments to fit the format to
      Returns:
      the reformatted named function
